page.title: 09MILTON OF DUMBRECK (CONT)
page.content: the wetter areas in the estate and therefore{drainage}is extensive.The dampness of the area sometimes causes a{disease}called{Foot-rot}in the sheep. With the farm being relatively old the buildings are{stone-built}although there is a modern{Dutch barn}which was built in the last ten years.Other {alterations}under consideration include the replacement of several floors in other barns which through the years have become dilapidated and the construction of a much-needed {silo. {Fertilisers}used are predominantly {chemical}and must be sprayed on the crops at definite times of the year.{Animal breeding}is also restricted to certain periods of the year and few{scientific aids}are employed.When the animals are ready to
